entities.title: Connect to MySQL from Node
entities.description: Any web app needs to persist data somehow, and relational databases are always a good option for any web app. In this article i’m going to show you how to connect a node application to a MySQL database.

entities.title: Terraform Modules
entities.description: A terraform file can get very large very quickly as you add more and more resource blocks. Custom modules are a great way of organizing your terraform code into logical pieces. You might have one module that handles the VPC set up, one that handles RDS, and another for EC2 instances. In this post, we’ll \[…\]

entities.title: Cloud-init and Terraform with AWS
entities.description: In this article, we’ll look at how to use cloud-init with terraform to install and configure nginx on an EC2 instance.

entities.title: S3 and IAM with Terraform
entities.description: In this post, we will look at how to set up an S3 bucket and an EC2 instance using terraform. entities.description: In this post, we’ll go over the basic structure of a terraform module and how to use variables and outputs in the root module.

Now that we know how to inject the database, we can learn about mocking. In this article, we will \[…\]

entities.description: There are a few benefits to using dependency injection, but the best, most useful benefit and biggest reason to use dependency injection is to make your code more testable. entities.title: Testing an Express App With Supertest and Jest
entities.description: In this article, we’re going to look at how to use TDD to test an express API using the supertest and jest frameworks. Jest is a javascript test runner for running automated tests, and supertest provides a high-level abstraction for testing HTTP. The app that we will be testing will will contain a single endpoint \[…\]

entities.title: SQL & DDL: A Quick Guide to Creating Tables

In this article, we will use the Data Definition Language (DDL) to learn about the basics of creating tables, choosing data types, adding constraints and default values.
